sys_properties_category.title:
OneSearch Details and System Properties

OneSearch is an efficient and powerful search utility for ServiceNow. Use OneSearch to add dynamic searching capabilities to your forms, catalog items, and pages.

  • Create customized searchers for forms, catalog items, and pages.
  • Use server-side scripting to take full control of how searches are performed:
    • Perform queries against any local table, knowledge base, service catalog, etc.
    • Utilize web services to query external data sources.
    • Perform advanced calculations and data correlations for customized results.
  • Use client-side scripting to add active elements to your search results
    • Create buttons to automatically link search results to the current record.
    • Utilize GlideAjax to trigger server-side functionality.
  • Customize the look and feel of searchers to match your instance branding.
  • Add multiple sections to each searcher to provide all of the information your users require.
  • Set role-based visibility for each searcher section, providing relevant results by role.
  • Tailor the behavior of each searcher to maximize usability and performance.

OneSearch makes it simple to minimize time spent searching for answers and maximize productivity.

Notes:

  • Any searched table must have 'text_index' set to true to return results.
  • For 'form' searchers, the OneSearch formatter must be added to the appropriate form. Do this by right-clicking the form-header, clicking 'Configure form layout', and choosing the OneSearch formatter from the list. Place it where desired on the form, usually beneath the short description field.
  • For 'catalog item/record producer' searcher, a new 'macro' variable must be added to the item - this item must reference the 'onesearch_widget' UI macro. Place the variable where desired on the form, usually beneath the variable that triggers the search.
  • For 'ui page' or 'other (by url)' searchers, an HTML input field must be added to the UI page and given an 'id' attribute (ie - <input type="text" id="onesearch_input" />). In addition, the 'onesearch_widget' UI macro must be added to the UI page where desired, and it must reference the id of the input field (ie - <g:macro_invoke macro="sn_onesearch_onesearch_widget" />). An example UI page, 'onesearch_page', is included with the app for reference. In order to utilize OneSearch on a CMS page or homepage, use the UI page within an iFrame or a dynamic content block. An example dynamic content block, 'OneSearch', is included with the app for reference.
  • Want to link directly to a set of search results? For a UI/CMS page or catalog item, simply add a parameter of 'sysparm_onesearch=[search term]' to the valid URL of the page (note: the full URL is not generally what is displayed in your browser bar - be sure to use the full link to your destination page).
